macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: U.S. stocks close higher after latest jobs report
items.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 237.96 points (0.48%) to 49,504.07, the S&P 500 added 44.82 points (0.65%) to 6,966.28, and the Nasdaq Composite Index increased 191.33 points (0.81%) to 23,671.35 on Friday. All three major benchmarks recorded gains for the week, with materials and utilities sectors leading advances.

items.title: Trump administration directs Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to purchase $200 billion in mortgage-backed securities
items.summary: The administration announced a directive for mortgage giants to purchase $200 billion in mortgage-backed securities aimed at lowering borrowing costs. The Supreme Court is scheduled to rule on the legality of reciprocal tariffs on January 14.

items.title: Intel surges 10.8% following productive meeting between Trump and CEO
items.summary: Intel stock surged 10.8% following reports of a productive meeting between U.S. President Trump and the company's CEO Lip-Bu Tan.

items.title: European equity markets open 2026 with strong momentum
items.summary: European equity markets have opened 2026 with strong momentum, pushing several major indices to record highs, including Germany's DAX. January 2025 ranked among the strongest January performances on record for several European indices.

items.title: Federal Reserve delivers third rate cut of the year in December
items.summary: The Federal Reserve cut the federal funds rate by 0.25% on December 10, marking the third rate cut of the year. Additional cuts are expected to support double-digit corporate earnings growth in 2026.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin holds near $90.5K as crypto market grinds higher
items.summary: Bitcoin traded around $90,586 over the last 24 hours, up about 0.1%, as leverage continued to unwind and total crypto liquidations remained relatively low at roughly $66.9 million, suggesting a cooler, less speculative environment.

items.title: Binance Coin leads large caps with modest daily gains
items.summary: Binance Coin (BNB) outperformed major cryptocurrencies over the past day, rising about 1.2% to $910.28 on what appears to be spot-driven accumulation, while retail sentiment around BNB on Stocktwits shifted from neutral to bearish despite the price gain.

items.title: Tether mints $1B USDT amid macro uncertainty and delayed tariff ruling
items.summary: Tether minted $1 billion in new USDT as crypto markets reacted to a delayed Supreme Court tariff ruling that coincided with a rapid $2,100 spike in Bitcoin within about 45 minutes, while stronger-than-expected U.S. labor data tempered hopes for near-term rate cuts and kept traders cautious.

items.title: U.S. Senate Banking Committee schedules markup of CLARITY Act
items.summary: Crypto traders are watching the upcoming January 15 markup of the CLARITY Act in the U.S. Senate Banking Committee, a market-structure bill that aims to provide clearer rules for digital assets, enhance consumer protections, and allow banks to stake and earn interest, potentially drawing more capital onshore to the U.S. market.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Analyst Dan Ives projects AI spending to hit $2 trillion and mark 'fourth industrial revolution'
items.summary: Tech analyst Dan Ives forecasts that global AI spending across infrastructure, software, chips, and services will reach about $2 trillion in 2026, with more money invested in the next two years than in the previous decade, framing this as an early-stage '1996 moment' rather than a late-cycle bubble. He highlights NVIDIA, Microsoft, and Palantir as core AI beneficiaries while pointing to downstream opportunities in areas like cybersecurity and sovereign initiatives as AI adoption accelerates in enterprises and governments.

items.title: McKinsey reveals it now uses 25,000 AI agents alongside 40,000 human employees
items.summary: McKinsey's global managing partner Bob Sternfels says the firm is running a '25 squared' model, with 25,000 AI agents working with 40,000 humans and expectations of parity between agents and people by year-end, fundamentally reshaping its consulting workforce. AI agents have reportedly saved 1.5 million hours in search and synthesis work and produced 2.5 million charts in six months, enabling 25% growth in client-facing roles while back-office positions shrink by a similar margin.

items.title: MIT highlights Andrew Ng talk on emerging opportunities in AI
items.summary: MIT News has published material around Andrew Ng's 'Opportunities in AI' talk, emphasizing practical skill-building in machine learning and applied AI. The piece underscores continued demand for hands-on AI capabilities and frames AI as a core driver of future technical and business innovation.

items.title: Commentary points to 2026 'efficiency revolution' driven by small AI models
items.summary: An industry analysis argues that smaller AI models in 2026 are increasingly matching or surpassing frontier-scale systems on many tasks while running at a fraction of the cost, shifting attention toward efficiency, specialization, and edge deployment. The piece frames this as a structural trend that could rebalance investment from giant frontier models toward compact, domain-tuned systems.

items.title: Security experts discuss growing role of 'agentic AI' in critical system operations
items.summary: A security-focused analysis outlines why organizations are increasingly considering 'agentic AI'—autonomous or semi-autonomous AI agents—for managing critical system operations, from infrastructure monitoring to incident response. The article emphasizes the need to align these agents with clear strategic objectives and robust governance to safely capture ROI from highly automated AI operations.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
